intro: Mazus xiuningensis, commonly known as the Xiuning mazus, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
